stories.text:
I've been working on logging for a while and I've released and open sourced a new Java logging API I'm really happy with.

Echopraxia [1] is a Java logging API like SLF4J, but built around structured logging, i.e. the basic log entry is a JSON object and log files are typically NDJSON. It also has conditions, context, and also has semantic and fluent logging options.

Here's a Spring Boot Example [2].

And here's my blog post [3].

[1] https://github.com/tersesystems/echopraxia

[2] https://github.com/tersesystems/echopraxia-spring-boot-example

[3] https://tersesystems.com/blog/2022/01/02/echopraxia-a-better-java-logging-api/
stories.title: Show HN: Echopraxia, a better Java Logging API
Next.js/MDX: automatically add ids and links to subheadings (h1/h2) in articles

stories.text:
A previous thread (https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=12715179) pointed to

* Linear Digressions (now finished, http://lineardigressions.com/)

* Talking Machines (http://www.thetalkingmachines.com/)

* Data Skeptic (https://dataskeptic.com/)

as good podcasts on machine learning or data science, but I'm curious - which other current podcasts do ML practitioners and data scientists on HN recommend?

Some preferences:

* Graduate level (doesn't need to explain the fundamental structure of an ANN)

* Covers practical deployments of models and recently published research, not "what can AI do in the future" predictions
stories.title: Ask HN: Recommendations for podcasts about machine learning or data science?
